Judul: PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY PORANG GLUCOMANNAN FROM PORANG FLOUR VIA WET MILLING
Abstrak:
The world is becoming more aware of healthier lifestyles. One of the upcoming healthy
products in Indonesia is shirataki products, which are made from glucomannan. The
most known glucomannan source is konjac (Amorphophallus konjac). Konjac
glucomannan has been used by the Japanese and Chinese since ancient times due to
their versatility. Porang (Amorphophallus muelleri), a plant that abundantly grown in
Indonesia, is recently becoming well-known to be a good source of glucomannan.
However, with the lack of technology and knowledge, many porang farmers in
Indonesia sell their crops as dried chips or flour to countries like Japan and China.
Wet milling is one of the widely used methods used for glucomannan extraction and
ethanol being one the common solvents used. In this research, porang flour produced by
CV. Sanindo Putra will be used as the raw material. Fresh porang tubers are harvested,
sliced, dried, crushed, milled and polished to produce porang flour. This experiment
processes porang flour via wet milling with the aid of ethanol as solvent. The objective
of this research is to investigate the effect of length of milling time and ethanol
concentration on glucomannan content, chemical composition, viscosity and color of
the extracted porang glucomannan (PGM).
The variations of this experiment are determined using two-level factorial design with
three center points and four corner points. The two main variables which are observed
in this experiment are ethanol concentration (50%, 70% and 90%) and milling time (5
mins, 25 mins and 45 mins). The extracted porang glucomannan will then be
characterized using viscometer to analyze viscosity; spectrophotometer to analyze color
and electronic balance to analyze yield.
This experiment has achieved the production of porang glucomannan with a viscosity of
28,000 cP, a degree of whiteness of 52.63 and a yield of 80.7% while incorporating
70% ethanol concentration in the wet milling process for 25 minutes.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Tjokorde Walmiki Samadhi, S.T., M.T., Ph.D.
Kata Kunci: Porang Glucomannan; Porang Flour; Wet Milling; Color; Viscosity
